page.title: 10HITCHIN,LEATHER INDUSTRY
page.content: {Russell's Leather Works}was founded in 1783. There was a plentiful supply of water from the River Hiz and ample {sheepskins}from the flocks kept on the nearby Chiltern Hills. Nowadays 50% of the sheepskins are bought in the U.K. and 50% from New Zealand. Today the sheepskins are split in two by machinery. The bottom or inner half is the{flescher.} This is tanned with cod liver oil to become{chamois leather: 50% of which is exported to the U.S.A. The top half or outside is vegetable tanned to make{pickled {grain leather. Goatskins}are imported from Nigeria to make{Oasis Goat {Leather}to be used for expensive book binding.{Lambskins}are used to make {suede.} The firm is now part of a large group exporting to 75 countries.
